required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Explore the Effect of Secukinumab, Compared to Placebo, on Fat Tissue and Skin in Plaque Psoriasis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Multicenter Study to Explore Changes in Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue and Modulation of Skin Inflammation After 12 Weeks of Treatment With Secukinumab, Compared to Placebo, and up to 52 Weeks of Treatment With Secukinumab in Adult Patients With Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will provide a comparison of secukinumab to placebo with respect to skin inflammation as measured by skin exams in comparison to skin biopsies, adipose tissue and blood sample analyses.

study_design_info.masking: Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor

primary_outcome.measure: Response of psoriasis skin lesions to treatment
primary_outcome.description: Response in skin histology/K16 expression to treatment (yes, no)

primary_outcome.measure: Response of psoriasis skin lesions to treatment
primary_outcome.description: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 90 (yes, no)

secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs (blood pressure, weight, waist circumference, body mass index), clinical laboratory variables (glucose, insulin, hs-CRP, HOMA-IR, HbA1c)

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of psoriasis skin lesions to treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Response in skin histology/K16 expression to treatment (yes, no)

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of psoriasis skin lesions to treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 90 (yes, no)

arm_group.description: Eligible patients will receive secukinumab 300 mg s.c. at randomization, Weeks 1, 2, 3 and 4 followed by monthly dosing up to Week 48

Eligible patients will receive placebo at randomization, Weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, and 8. At Week 12, patients will be switched to treatment with secukinumab 300 mg s.c. at Weeks 12, 13, 14, 15, and 16 followed by monthly dosing up to Week 48

intervention.description: Secukinumab 300 mg s.c. at randomization, Weeks 1, 2, 3, and 4 followed by monthly dosing up to Week 48
Placebo s.c. at randomization, Weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, and 8; secukinumab 300 mg s.c. at Weeks 12, 13, 14, 15, and 16 followed by monthly dosing up to Week 48

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent must be obtained before any assessment is performed
- Clinical diagnosis of chronic plaque-type psoriasis at least 6 months prior to randomization
- Moderate to severe plaque psoriasis as defined at baseline by:
- ≥10% Body Surface Area (BSA) involvement and
- PASI total score of ≥12 and
- IGA mod 2011 score of ≥3 (based on a scale of 0-4)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Forms of diagnosed psoriasis other than chronic plaque psoriasis
- Medication-induced or medication exacerbated psoriasis
- Previous exposure to secukinumab or any other biologic drug directly targeting IL-17A or IL-17RA receptors
- Ongoing use of prohibited treatments
- Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply
